title: Auto stocks rise up to 3% on GST 2.0, festive demand hopes: Here's what brokerages say
content: The shares of auto companies gained on September 16, after recording losses in four out of the past five sessions. Brokerages remain bullish over the sector's outlook, suggesting strong upside potential for the stocks. The Nifty Auto index rose 0.84 percent to 26,986.75, according to data on NSE at 1.10 pm. This comes amid easing trade tensions between India and US, optimism over India-European Union trade deal and expectations of rising festive demand following GST reforms boosted investor sentiment. GST reforms: Centre recently announced strong cuts to the GST structure, which will take effect later this month. Analysts estimate that the GST rate cuts will strongly spur demand around Navratri, and benefit the automakers. Maruti Suzuki has seen a 15 percent increase in customer inquiries since the GST rate cut announcement, the automaker's Head of Sales and Marketing Partho Banerjee recently told CNBC-TV18. "Overall bookings now stand at 1.5 lakh, with 10,000 new bookings coming in daily," he added. Cooling India-US trade tensions: Indo-US relations have seen some improvement in recent days with Trump and Prime Minister Narendra Modi agreeing to resume trade talks. Trump called Prime Minister Modi a "dear friend" and talked optimistically about the trade momentum. PM Modi, in turn, reaffirmed India and US as "close friends and natural partners" and expressed confidence that current trade talks would unlock significant potential for both nations. Brendan Lynch, a key US trade negotiator arrived today in India to discuss 'trade issues' between Washington and New Delhi. Special Secretary Rajesh Agarwal however clarified that Lynch's one-day visit is not the sixth round of trade negotiations between India and US, but only a meeting to 'discuss' trade issues. The cooling trade tensions between India and US, and increasing hopes of the two countries resuming trade talks may have boosted auto and auto ancillary stocks. India-EU trade deal: India and EU held their 13th round of talks for the proposed trade deal from September 8-12. The next round of talks will be held in Brussels from October 6-10 as both sides aim to conclude negotiations at the earliest. This too may act as a strong boost for the auto and auto ancillary stocks. MRF shares were the top gainers on the index, jumping nearly 3 percent to trade at Rs 1,51,780 apiece. Balkrishna Industries and Bharat Forge shares followed, rising around 2 percent each. Samvardhana Motherson, Bosch, Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M), Eicher Motors and Maruti Suzuki shares gained more than 1 percent each, while TVS Motor, Tube Investments of India and Hero MotoCorp shares were up around 1 percent each. Ashok Leyland, Bajaj Auto and Exide Industries shares were trading in the green with marginal gains. Bucking the trend, Tata Motors shares were trading in the red with marginal losses. HSBC on auto sector: HSBC in its latest report said that GST-driven price cuts announced by the automakers will boost their CAGR by 200-300 basis points over the next four-five years. The international brokerage noted that the auto stocks have jumped 6-17 percent since the centre's GST revision announcement in August. It added that this will likely track earnings growth. Growth could be front-loaded, HSBC said while raising FY27-28 EPS estimates across companies by 4–14 percent. Here are the latest rating and target prices set by the international brokerage:Maruti Suzuki – Buy call, Target price at Rs 17,000 per shareHyundai Motor India – Buy call, Target price at Rs 2,800 per shareTVS Motor – Buy call, Target price at Rs 4,000 per shareM&M – Buy call, Target price at Rs 4,000 per shareAther Energy – Buy call, Target price at Rs 600 per shareInCred on autos: InCred sees GST rate cuts and cess withdrawal as biggest stimulus for auto sector in recent history. It said that these could trigger a two-three year cyclical recovery. The domestic brokerage raised domestic auto volume forecasts by 300 bps to 11 percent for FY26, and by 500 bps to 15 percent for FY27, led by passenger vehicles. InCred has upgraded its ratings on Apollo Tyres, Escorts Kubota, M&M and Tata Motors. Nomura on autos: Nomura said the GST cuts are leading to early signs of demand recovery. It prefers M&M, Hyundai, TVS Motor and Ashok Leyland among the stocks. The cuts have translated into immediate benefits for buyers and firms are reporting stronger enquiries, surge in bookings and an improved outlook for festive demand, the brokerage said. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: The cooling trade tensions between India and US, and increasing hopes of the two countries resuming trade talks may have boosted auto and auto ancillary stocks.
summary_luhn: Here are the latest rating and target prices set by the international brokerage:Maruti Suzuki – Buy call, Target price at Rs 17,000 per shareHyundai Motor India – Buy call, Target price at Rs 2,800 per shareTVS Motor – Buy call, Target price at Rs 4,000 per shareM&M – Buy call, Target price at Rs 4,000 per shareAther Energy – Buy call, Target price at Rs 600 per shareInCred on autos: InCred sees GST rate cuts and cess withdrawal as biggest stimulus for auto sector in recent history.

title: KEI Industries shares rise 2.18%, stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of KEI Industries were trading at Rs 4,185 in Tuesday's session, marking a 2.18% increase. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Snapshot: Here's a look at KEI Industries' consolidated financial performance: Revenue: KEI Industries has demonstrated consistent revenue growth over the past five years. The annual revenue increased from Rs 4,181.54 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 9,735.88 Crore in March 2025.YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Mar 2021Rs 4,181.54 CroreMar 2022Rs 5,726.55 CroreMar 2023Rs 6,912.33 CroreMar 2024Rs 8,104.08 CroreMar 2025Rs 9,735.88 CroreNet Profit: The company's net profit has also shown a steady increase. Net profit rose from Rs 273.31 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 696.41 Crore in March 2025.YearNet Profit (Rs Crore)Mar 2021Rs 273.31 CroreMar 2022Rs 375.98 CroreMar 2023Rs 477.34 CroreMar 2024Rs 580.85 CroreMar 2025Rs 696.41 CroreEarnings Per Share (EPS): The earnings per share have increased consistently over the years. EPS grew from Rs 30.47 in March 2021 to Rs 75.65 in March 2025.YearEPS (Rs)Mar 2021Rs 30.47Mar 2022Rs 41.77Mar 2023Rs 52.94Mar 2024Rs 64.37Mar 2025Rs 75.65Quarterly Performance: The company's quarterly revenue has also been robust. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,590.32 Crore, compared to Rs 2,060.50 Crore in June 2024.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Jun 2024Rs 2,060.50 CroreSep 2024Rs 2,279.65 CroreDec 2024Rs 2,467.27 CroreMar 2025Rs 2,914.79 CroreJun 2025Rs 2,590.32 CroreThe net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 195.75 Crore, compared to Rs 150.25 Crore in June 2024.QuarterNet Profit (Rs Crore)Jun 2024Rs 150.25 CroreSep 2024Rs 154.81 CroreDec 2024Rs 164.81 CroreMar 2025Rs 226.55 CroreJun 2025Rs 195.75 CroreThe EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 20.49, compared to Rs 16.65 in June 2024.QuarterEPS (Rs)Jun 2024Rs 16.65Sep 2024Rs 17.16Dec 2024Rs 17.87Mar 2025Rs 23.71Jun 2025Rs 20.49Corporate Actions: KEI Industries has scheduled meetings with analysts and institutional investors. On September 18, 2025, the company will meet with analysts from Jefferies India Private Limited in Gurugram and Axis Capital Limited in Mumbai. Additionally, the company had meetings scheduled with Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd, Elara Securities (India) Private Limited and Goldman Sachs (India) Securities Pvt. Ltd. on September 2nd, 3rd, and 4th, 2025, respectively. The company announced an interim dividend of Rs 4 per share on January 3, 2025, with an effective date of January 27, 2025. The company had announced an interim dividend of Rs 3.50 per share on March 1, 2024, with an effective date of March 19, 2024. KEI Industries had a stock split on December 21, 2006, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 2. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock as of September 16, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 4,185, KEI Industries shows a positive trend, supported by strong financial performance and investor confidence.

title: Godrej Industries share price falls 2.05%, stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Godrej Industries shares declined by 2.05% to Rs 1,218 at 2:09 pm on Tuesday, pulling the stock among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. title: Buy Kirloskar Pneumatic Company; target of Rs 1636: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Kirloskar Pneumatic Company We interacted with the management of Kirloskar Pneumatic Company (KKPC), who reiterated a strong demand outlook for Air and Refrigeration compressors despite subdued order bookings amid finalization delays which is expected to show strong rebound in H2FY26. In the Air compression segment, Tezcatlipoca centrifugal compressors are witnessing strong traction and gaining market share. Refrigeration compressors continue to see robust demand from industrial and commercial end-users, with revenue contribution expected to rise to ~45% (vs ~35% earlier). The Gas compression segment remains subdued, although demand for gas booster packages continues to be healthy. KKPC’s continued new product launches, such as Tyche, are expected to drive the next leg of growth while new initiatives such as RenovAir replacement scheme is expected to pave way for market share gains. Looking ahead, management targets ~20% CAGR in revenues with EBITDA margins scaling up to ~20%, supported by market share gains, new product launches and eventual foray into export markets. Outlook The stock is currently trading at a PE of 32.5x/26.9x on FY26/27E. We reiterate our ‘Buy’ rating valuing the stock at a PE of 35x on FY27E (same as earlier), arriving at a TP of Rs1,636 (same as earlier). For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Kirloskar Pneumatic Company - 16092025 - prabhu

title: Market participants seek protocol after September’s last-minute holiday change shook the settlement system
content: Earlier this month, stock exchanges had received an official communication about a holiday on Monday, September 8, which was previously scheduled on Friday, and while it looked like a routine adjustment, at the back end, this led to big chaos. Sebi’s settlement, which operates on T+1, had to move to T+2 for cash and T+3 for derivatives on short notice. From Sebi to brokers, custodians, foreign portfolio investors, mutual funds, and clearing corporations, everyone has a story to share about how this last-moment tweak forced them to burn the midnight oil to resolve the settlement issues. Thankfully, the settlement was completed without any major issue, but it created chaos at the back end. What Exactly Happened? Once the Maharashtra government announced the change in holiday which was scheduled on September 5, banking regulator RBI changed the bank’s holiday to Monday, September 8, as it had to follow states’ holiday calendar as per the Negotiable Instruments Act. RBI communicated the change in holiday to banks and other entities, and when banks are on holiday, fund settlements can’t happen, leaving investors to wait for their funds. How Did the Tweak Impacted the Market? The stock exchanges and clearing corporations make the settlement calendars a year in advance, based on the dates of holidays, and any changes midway can disrupt the whole cycle. How Did FPIs get Impacted? Foreign Portfolio Investors book their foreign exchange based on a TOMO basis - in simple terms, based on tomorrow’s expected price. In this instance, the forex was booked for Monday, and Friday was a holiday as per the earlier plan. In this case, the calculation and fund arrangement went for a toss. Given that the FPIs trade in huge quantities, any change in forex price can impact the cost of trading. How Did Investors get Impacted? Investors were impacted as the funds expected to be credited into their accounts got delayed, leading to to additional margin requirement as previous margins had got blocked. The BTST or Buy Today Sell Tomorrow trade also got impacted as traders could not get the sale money the next day. The settlement for the derivative segment of three trade days - September 4 (Thursday), September 5 (Friday), and September 8 (Monday) - was undertaken on September 9 (Tuesday). Similarly, the settlement for the cash and SLBM segment for September 8 (Monday) and September 9 (Tuesday) was undertaken on September 10 (Wednesday). Exchanges and clearing corporations had to break the settlement part into two days, otherwise the settlement system would have crashed because of the sheer size of trading volume. Stock exchanges, clearing corporations, custodians, and the regulator had to literally burn the midnight oil to ensure smooth settlement. Custodians Worked till 4 AM As per industry sources, custodians and fund accounting teams had to work till early morning to prepare the files for settlement. Not only this, one industry insider said they also had to face FPI queries on how there could be a sudden change in holidays. Some FPIs even mocked the ‘one nation, multiple regulations’ approach, as they could not understand the nuances of local rules. Corporate Action Trigger Market participants concur that a big chaos was averted as there were no major corporate actions except a few dividend issues. If a bonus announcement or some other issue had been effective from Monday, it could have become an issue, as investors who were eligible may have lost the opportunity because of settlement issues. For example, if one had bought shares on Friday on a cum basis and expected to get them on Monday as Friday was a settlement holiday, but the settlement moved to Tuesday. In such a case, they may have lost significantly as they would have received shares on an ex basis – without the bonus shares and prices adjusted accordingly. In such situations, companies cannot be suddenly asked to change their record dates. Incidentally, exchanges were working on both days, Friday and Monday. Sebi and exchanges also issued an alert to investors about the impact on corporate action ex-date and cum-date. MF Debt Schemes Impacted Market participants said debt fund transactions too were impacted due to the sudden change in holiday schedule. As payments are not processed on holidays but the next business day, unit prices change, and investors get the NAV of the next business day. How to Avoid Chaos Next Time? In a situation like this, market participants said the regulators should have a formal way of communication and assess if the regulated entities get impacted because of the tweaks. It will help the market handle things smoothly. They also said that once the trading day starts, the date of settlement should not change. Some participants also say when 24x7 systems like NEFT, RTGS, and UPI are there, then do we really need a settlement calendar?
summary_lexrank: For example, if one had bought shares on Friday on a cum basis and expected to get them on Monday as Friday was a settlement holiday, but the settlement moved to Tuesday.
summary_luhn: Earlier this month, stock exchanges had received an official communication about a holiday on Monday, September 8, which was previously scheduled on Friday, and while it looked like a routine adjustment, at the back end, this led to big chaos.
summary_lsa: Not only this, one industry insider said they also had to face FPI queries on how there could be a sudden change in holidays.
summary_textrank: Once the Maharashtra government announced the change in holiday which was scheduled on September 5, banking regulator RBI changed the bank’s holiday to Monday, September 8, as it had to follow states’ holiday calendar as per the Negotiable Instruments Act.

title: Syngene Intl, Godrej Ind among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Syngene Intl were among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150, trading at Rs 655.30, a fall of 2.31 percent in Tuesday's session. Other stocks that declined include Godrej Ind, Vodafone Idea, BSE Limited and Max Healthcare. Financial Snapshot of Syngene Intl: Syngene Intl's financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue over the past few years. title: India revokes Novartis' patent for blockbuster heart drug
content: Indian Patent Office (IPO) has revoked Novartis AG’s patent on its blockbuster heart-failure drug Entresto, sold as Vymada in India, saying the Swiss drug company’s claims lacked novelty. Vymada is widely prescribed for hypertension and heart failure. For Novartis, the drug is a major revenue driver, generating $7.8 billion in global sales last year. The September 12 decision by the deputy controller of patents and designs could pave the way for affordable generics. While cancelling the patent for the “supramolecular complex” of sacubitril and valsartan, the active ingredients in Vymada, D Usha Rao said Novartis failed to show any clear therapeutic advantage of its claimed “supramolecular complex” over existing formulations. The order followed a post-grant opposition filed by the Indian Pharmaceutical Alliance (IPA), an industry group representing major domestic drugmakers. Two companies — IPCA and Micro Labs — also opposed the patent at the post‑grant stage. “The patentee has failed to disclose any demonstrated advantages or technical advancement of the claimed supramolecular complex over the combination already disclosed…,” the controller wrote in the order. Moneycontrol has reviewed a copy of the order. “No experimental data, comparative studies, or technical rationale have been provided to substantiate any enhanced efficacy. Further, no improved therapeutic efficacy has been shown,” Rao said. The patent fell foul of multiple provisions of the Patents Act. The ruling caps nearly two years of litigation that began in December 2023 when IPA challenged the patent on grounds of lack of novelty, prior claiming, obviousness, and insufficiency of disclosure. The opposing parties twice recommended revocation and after a Delhi High Court-directed round of rebuttal evidence, the controller held a final hearing on August 20. Novartis’s representatives abstained from the proceedings, the order said. On February 13, 2009, Novartis was granted a patent for a drug combining valsartan and sacubitril. That patent expired on January 16, 2023, paving the way for dozens of copycats. Novartis then claimed that a particular crystalline form, for which it was granted patent, was essential to Entresto's function, and blocked generic drugmakers from copying its crystalline form. Indian firms opposed the patent, questioning whether the crystalline form offered a therapeutic advantage over earlier ones.. The controller sided with the opponents, who argued that the patent was an attempt at “evergreening” — extending monopoly rights without meaningful innovation — a practice India’s patent law seeks to curb. Novartis spokesperson declined to comment. The drugmaker can appeal the decision in the Delhi High Court.
summary_lexrank: On February 13, 2009, Novartis was granted a patent for a drug combining valsartan and sacubitril.
summary_luhn: While cancelling the patent for the “supramolecular complex” of sacubitril and valsartan, the active ingredients in Vymada, D Usha Rao said Novartis failed to show any clear therapeutic advantage of its claimed “supramolecular complex” over existing formulations.
summary_lsa: For Novartis, the drug is a major revenue driver, generating $7.8 billion in global sales last year.
summary_textrank: “The patentee has failed to disclose any demonstrated advantages or technical advancement of the claimed supramolecular complex over the combination already disclosed…,” the controller wrote in the order.

title: Syngene International shares fall 2.16%, stock among losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Syngene International declined by 2.16% to Rs 656.30 in Tuesday's session, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The decline reflects a bearish trend for the stock. Financial Performance: Syngene International's financial performance shows steady growth in revenue over the past few years. Here’s an overview of the company’s consolidated financial highlights:ParticularsMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)Rs 2,184.30 CroreRs 2,604.20 CroreRs 3,192.90 CroreRs 3,488.60 CroreRs 3,642.40 CroreNet Profit (Rs Crore)Rs 404.90 CroreRs 395.80 CroreRs 464.40 CroreRs 510.00 CroreRs 496.20 CroreEPS (Rs)10.189.9411.5912.7112.35BVPS (Rs)70.5482.2890.13105.92117.44ROE (%)14.3512.0012.8311.9710.49Debt to Equity0.270.240.160.030.03The revenue has increased consistently from Rs 2,184.30 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 3,642.40 Crore in March 2025. However, the net profit saw a slight decrease from Rs 510.00 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 496.20 Crore in March 2025. Here’s an overview of the company’s consolidated quarterly financial highlights:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)Rs 789.70 CroreRs 891.00 CroreRs 943.70 CroreRs 1,018.00 CroreRs 874.50 CroreNet Profit (Rs Crore)Rs 75.70 CroreRs 106.10 CroreRs 131.10 CroreRs 183.30 CroreRs 86.70 CroreEPS (Rs)1.892.643.274.562.16The revenue has increased from Rs 789.70 crore in June 2024 to Rs 1,018.00 crore in March 2025, but decreased to Rs 874.50 crore in June 2025. Similarly, the net profit increased from Rs 75.70 crore in June 2024 to Rs 183.30 crore in March 2025, before decreasing to Rs 86.70 crore in June 2025. Corporate Actions: Syngene International announced a final dividend of Rs 1.25 per share (12.5%) on April 23, 2025, with the ex-date as June 27, 2025. The company also had a bonus issue on April 24, 2019, with a bonus ratio of 1:1. Moneycontrol analysis on September 10, 2025, indicated a neutral sentiment for the stock. Syngene International is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty Midcap 150 index.

title: Gold hits fresh record high on Fed rate cut hopes; Manappuram, IIFL Finance shares jump up to 3%
content: The shares of gold financiers jumped on September 16 as the precious metal hit fresh record high levels ahead of the US Federal Reserve's FOMC meeting. This comes as analysts increasingly expect the American central bank to cut rates this time, amid weak jobs data and rising pressure from President Donald Trump's administration. "Gold prices scaled a record peak, supported by a weaker dollar and US Yields ahead of the Federal Reserve's policy meeting this week, where the central bank is widely expected to cut borrowing rates," said Manav Modi from Motilal Oswal Financial Services. Gold futures at record high: Gold futures on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) with October expiry hit a lifetime high of Rs 1,10,548 per 10 grams. Gold futures with December expiry hit a fresh lifetime high of Rs 1,11,599 per 10 grams. In the domestic markets, the price of 10 grams of 24k gold increased by Rs 870 to Rs 1,11,930, according to data on GoodReturns. The rising gold prices bodes well for gold financiers, as it increases the value of the collateral while issuing loans. This reduces the risk of default, as the collateral becomes more valuable relative to the loan amount issued against it. Gold financiers stocks jump: IIFL Finance shares jumped more than 3.5 percent to trade at Rs 455.10 apiece. The stock has surged around 38 percent in the past six months, and more than 7 percent in 2025 so far. Its P/E ratio currently stands at around 11. Manappuram Finance shares rose around 2 percent to hit a 52-week high of Rs 296 apiece. The stock gained 11 percent in the past one month, and over 42 percent in the past six months. It has rallied over 54 percent in 2025 so far. The stock’s P/E ratio currently stands at around 32. Muthoot Finance shares rose more than 2 percent to hit a 52-week high of Rs 2,996.90 apiece. The stock gained nearly 2 percent in the past five days, and more than 7 percent in the past one month. It rose over 28 percent in the past six months. It currently has a P/E ratio of more than 19. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Muthoot Finance shares rose more than 2 percent to hit a 52-week high of Rs 2,996.90 apiece.
summary_luhn: The stock gained 11 percent in the past one month, and over 42 percent in the past six months.
summary_lsa: "Gold prices scaled a record peak, supported by a weaker dollar and US Yields ahead of the Federal Reserve's policy meeting this week, where the central bank is widely expected to cut borrowing rates," said Manav Modi from Motilal Oswal Financial Services.
summary_textrank: The stock gained nearly 2 percent in the past five days, and more than 7 percent in the past one month.

title: Bharat Forge shares rise 2.05%; among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Bharat Forge gained 2.05% to trade at Rs 1,262.60 on Tuesday. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, Bharat Forge has demonstrated consistent performance. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,908.75 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 4,106.15 Crore reported for the quarter-ending June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 287.14 Crore, compared to Rs 173.89 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The company's Earnings Per Share (EPS) stood at Rs 5.93 for June 2025, up from Rs 4.36 in June 2024. Annually, Bharat Forge's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 15,122.80 Crore, a slight decrease compared to Rs 15,682.07 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. However, the net profit increased from Rs 904.84 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 916.98 Crore in March 2025. The EPS for these years were Rs 20.05 and Rs 20.43, respectively. Key financial ratios indicate a positive trajectory. The book value per share increased from Rs 153.88 in March 2024 to Rs 193.53 in March 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio improved from 1.05 in March 2024 to 0.68 in March 2025. title: Max Healthcare, Godrej Ind among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Several stocks experienced declines in Tuesday's trading session, with Max Healthcare, Godrej Ind, Syngene Intl, Vodafone Idea, and BSE Limited all registering losses. The Nifty Midcap 150 index reflected this downturn, with these stocks identified as among the top losers. Max Healthcare shares experienced a decline of 2.17%, reaching a price of Rs 1,149.90. Godrej Ind followed, with a decrease of 1.64%, bringing its share price to Rs 1,223.10. Syngene Intl saw a reduction of 1.39%, settling at Rs 661.45. Vodafone Idea's shares fell by 1.35% to Rs 8.03, while BSE Limited's shares decreased by 1.33%, resulting in a price of Rs 2,197.80. Quarterly revenue has risen consistently, with the latest figure for June 2025 standing at Rs 2,027.57 Crore. This represents an increase from Rs 1,542.95 Crore in June 2024. title: Energy stocks up for 5th session amid positive brokerage note; MGL, JSW Energy lead gains
content: The energy stocks extended their winning run for the fifth consecutive session on Tuesday, supported by positive brokerage views on the sector. The Nifty Energy index rose nearly 1 percent in today’s trade, taking its gains over the past five sessions to 3.3 percent. Aegis Logistics led the pack with a 7.5 percent jump to Rs 815.6 apiece on the NSE. The surge came after global brokerage JPMorgan initiated coverage on India’s logistics space, naming Delhivery and Aegis Logistics as top picks. Mahanagar Gas, Reliance Power, Gujarat State Petronet and GE Vernova T&D India also advanced, rising up to 4 percent in intraday trade. Among other gainers were Tata Power, JSW Energy, Suzlon and Bharat Heavy Electricals, which climbed up to 2 percent. Meanwhile, HSBC noted that government support for oil marketing companies (OMCs) and steady fuel demand were driving performance in the segment. The brokerage maintained a positive stance, giving ‘buy’ ratings on Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd (target price Rs 420), Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd (Rs 520) and Indian Oil Corporation Ltd (Rs 190). Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Incentive for shipbreaking on the anvil, select shipping and shipyard stocks abuzz on Centre's global ambitions
content: Shares of Essar Shipping and GE Shipping are sharply higher by 2.5-4.5 percent in trade on September 16, along with shipbuilders such as Cochin Shipyard and Mazagon Dock which are gaining by close to a percent each, a day after MoS for Ports and Shipping, Shantanu Thakur said the Centre plans to develop more shipyards and target 5 percent share of global shipbuilding market by 2030. The sentiment in select stocks was positive after Bloomberg News reported citing people familiar with the development that the Centre also has plans to rollout incentives worth Rs 4,000 crore to support the shipbreaking industry, likely by end of September. The incentives would be for the longer term and may also involve credit notes to ship owners bringing old vessels to Indian shores, the report said. Incentive for Shipbreaking This scheme for a shipbreaking credit note was announced in the Union budget and incentivises ship scrapping by issuing credit note for 40 percent of the scrap value, which can be reimbursed to buy new Made in India ships. Moneycontrol is yet to independently confirm the quantum of the incentive, though in the past, it has been reported that the Centre has ambitious plans to incentivize India's domestic shipping industry through various incentive schemes and sops. In this union budget, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman had proposed to set up a Maritime Development Fund (MDF) for financial assistance, via equity or debt securities. With an initial corpus of Rs 25,000 crore, MDF will have government's contribution at 49 percent while the rest will be from port authorities, PSUs, financial institutions as well as the private sector. "While the Shipbuilding Financial Assistance Policy (SBFAP) is designed to provide financial incentives to Indian shipyards, the Ship-breaking Credit Note further strengthens the domestic industry by encouraging investment and expansion. These measures are expected to drive capital inflows, create employment opportunities, and enhance sectoral competitiveness," Shipping Minister Sarbananda Sonowal had said after the budget announcement. Eye on Global Shipbuilding Market The Shipping Ministry has plans to develop new shipbuilding clusters of 1-1.2 million Gross Tonnage (GT) each. Sarbananda Sonowal had said earlier this year that public-private partnerships and international collaborations will be crucial to this ambition. "This strategic push is crucial in realising India’s vision of becoming a $30 trillion economy by 2047. By leveraging the Public-Private Partnership (PPP) model, the scheme is designed to attract private investment, promote modernisation, and advance green technologies," Sonowal had said. On September 15, MoS for Ports and Shipping, Shantanu Thakur had told a CII conference that India plans to add 10 world-class shipyards in the next five years. The government plans to develop "10 world-class shipyards by 2030, supported by public-private partnerships and international collaborations that will bring global best practices to Indian shores," Shantanu Thakur had said. "We are targeting a 5 percent share in the global shipbuilding market by 2030, a significant leap from our current position. This will be achieved through strategic investments in automation, digital twin technology and green shipbuilding innovations," MoS for Ports and Shipping added.
summary_lexrank: Sarbananda Sonowal had said earlier this year that public-private partnerships and international collaborations will be crucial to this ambition.
summary_luhn: Shares of Essar Shipping and GE Shipping are sharply higher by 2.5-4.5 percent in trade on September 16, along with shipbuilders such as Cochin Shipyard and Mazagon Dock which are gaining by close to a percent each, a day after MoS for Ports and Shipping, Shantanu Thakur said the Centre plans to develop more shipyards and target 5 percent share of global shipbuilding market by 2030.
summary_lsa: On September 15, MoS for Ports and Shipping, Shantanu Thakur had told a CII conference that India plans to add 10 world-class shipyards in the next five years.

title: NHPC shares rise 2.11% in Tuesday's session

title: Infosys shares fall 0.27%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Infosys were trading lower at Rs 1,504.40, a decline of 0.27% in Tuesday's session. The stock is currently among the top losers on Nifty 50 as of 12:10 pm. Financial Snapshot: Infosys has demonstrated steady financial performance. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 42,279 Crore, compared to Rs 39,315 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period stood at Rs 6,924 Crore, up from Rs 6,374 Crore year-over-year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) was Rs 16.70 in June 2025, compared to Rs 15.38 in June 2024. title: Textile stocks rise on hopes of India-US trade talks: KPR Mill, Indo Count, others rally up to 10%
content: The shares of textile companies surged on September 16 amid rising hopes for trade talks between India and US to resume. Brendan Lynch, a trade negotiator with the Office of the US Trade Representative (USTR) will be arriving today in India to discuss 'trade issues' between Washington and New Delhi. Special Secretary Rajesh Agarwal however clarified that Lynch's one-day visit is not the sixth round of trade negotiations between India and US, but only a meeting to 'discuss' trade issues. India-US trade relations: The two nations had opened negotiations for a Bilateral Trade Agreement (BTA) in March this year, and have conducted five rounds of talks so far, with the last one being held in July in the US. However, following US President Donald Trump's decision to double tariffs on India to a whopping 50 percent, the next round of trade talks slated for August 25-29 in New Delhi was deferred. Cooling trade jitters: Indo-US relations have seen some improvement in recent days with Trump and Prime Minister Narendra Modi agreeing to resume trade talks. Trump called Prime Minister Modi a "dear friend" and talked optimistically about the trade momentum. PM Modi, in turn, reaffirmed India and US as "close friends and natural partners" and expressed confidence that current trade talks would unlock significant potential for both nations.India and the US are close friends and natural partners. I am confident that our trade negotiations will pave the way for unlocking the limitless potential of the India-US partnership. Our teams are working to conclude these discussions at the earliest. I am also looking forward… pic.twitter.com/3K9hlJxWcl — Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) September 10, 2025 Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman too confirmed that New Delhi's diplomatic team is deeply engaged in ongoing negotiations. In a post on Truth Social, Trump had said, "I am pleased to announce that India, and the United States of America, are continuing negotiations to address the Trade Barriers between our two Nations." Textile stocks surge: All these developments reignited hopes for easing trade tensions between the two countries, which would likely benefit the export-oriented textile stocks. Indo Count Industries shares rallied around 10 percent to trade at Rs 307.79 apiece. KPR Mill shares surged 7 percent to trade at Rs 1,121.80 apiece, while Pearl Global Industries shares jumped nearly 6 percent. Raymond Lifestyle shares jumped nearly 4 percent. Arvind shares rose around 2 percent. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Cooling trade jitters: Indo-US relations have seen some improvement in recent days with Trump and Prime Minister Narendra Modi agreeing to resume trade talks.
summary_luhn: PM Modi, in turn, reaffirmed India and US as "close friends and natural partners" and expressed confidence that current trade talks would unlock significant potential for both nations.India and the US are close friends and natural partners.
summary_lsa: I am also looking forward… pic.twitter.com/3K9hlJxWcl — Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) September 10, 2025 Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman too confirmed that New Delhi's diplomatic team is deeply engaged in ongoing negotiations.
summary_textrank: India-US trade relations: The two nations had opened negotiations for a Bilateral Trade Agreement (BTA) in March this year, and have conducted five rounds of talks so far, with the last one being held in July in the US.

title: Buy Cummins India; target of Rs 4500: Mirae Asset Sharekhan
content: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's research report on Cummins India Cummins is experiencing a broad-based demand revival in powergen segment from across sectors such as Real estate, manufacturing, hospitals, datacenters, etc. Demand is picking up with price stabilization. High-HP products has seen a steady demand from Data centers, hospitals etc. Cummins emerging as a clear leader owing to early product launches, strong customer adoption, and aftermarket support. While CPCB IV+ volumes are currently tracking at 80–85% of CPCB-II levels, prices have largely held firm. Outlook We expect a 16%/16% CAGR in revenue/PAT (FY25-27E). Given the domestic demand uptick due to adoption of CPCB-IV emission norms and gradual recovery in export business, we maintain a Buy rating with a revised PT of Rs 4,500. title: L&T shares higher by a percent on 'significant' order of up to Rs 2,500 crore from NPCIL for Kudankulam nuclear plant
content: Engineering and construction giant L&T has bagged a 'significant' order worth up to Rs 2,500 crore from Nuclear Power Corporation (NPCIL) for the Kudankulam power project in Tamil Nadu, the company informed on September 16, sending the shares higher by a percent. The order was won by the Heavy Civil Infrastructure (HCI) vertical of L&T for 2x1000 Mwe Kudankulam Nuclear Power Project (KKNPP 5 & 6) which would involve installation of the reactor and turbine systems, sea water systems, and other related equipment. The order also includes accessories such as piping, structural steelwork, anti-corrosion coating, insulation and full testing across the structures. The HCI business is an EPC division for core civil infrastructure projects crucial to sectors such as Metros and High-Speed Rail (HSR), tunnels, nuclear power, ports as well as defence infrastructure. This business undertakes civil construction works for nuclear power plants and has expertise in construction of Pressurised Heavy Water Reactors (PHWR), Light Water Reactors (LWR) and Natural Draft Cooling Towers (NDCT). As part of the Viksit Bharat initiative, India has set a target of 100 GW nuclear power capacity by 2047, which will be supported by the Nuclear Energy Mission, including significant investments in R&D for Small Modular Reactors (SMRs). Centre has been looking to enhance domestic nuclear capabilities and private sector participation in such projects. During the June quarter earnings, L&T pegged the prospective order pipeline for infra for the next nine months at Rs 7.97 trillion, a rise of 32 percent on year. This prospects pipeline comprises of domestic prospects of Rs 5.04 trillion and international prospects of Rs 2.93 trillion. The sub-segment of Heavy Civil Infrastructure will make up for 17 percent of the total order prospects, the company has said. The orderbook for this segment is at Rs 3.7 trillion as of June 2025.
summary_lexrank: Engineering and construction giant L&T has bagged a 'significant' order worth up to Rs 2,500 crore from Nuclear Power Corporation (NPCIL) for the Kudankulam power project in Tamil Nadu, the company informed on September 16, sending the shares higher by a percent.
summary_luhn: The order was won by the Heavy Civil Infrastructure (HCI) vertical of L&T for 2x1000 Mwe Kudankulam Nuclear Power Project (KKNPP 5 & 6) which would involve installation of the reactor and turbine systems, sea water systems, and other related equipment.
summary_lsa: Centre has been looking to enhance domestic nuclear capabilities and private sector participation in such projects.
summary_textrank: The order was won by the Heavy Civil Infrastructure (HCI) vertical of L&T for 2x1000 Mwe Kudankulam Nuclear Power Project (KKNPP 5 & 6) which would involve installation of the reactor and turbine systems, sea water systems, and other related equipment.

title: Maruti Suzuki India share price hits all-time high of Rs 15,415; up 0.87%

title: Vodafone Idea among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150; shares decline 3.19%
content: Shares of Vodafone Idea were trading lower in Tuesday's session. At 10:30 am, the stock was trading at Rs 7.88 on the NSE, a 3.19% decline from the previous close. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 11,022.50 Crore, compared to Rs 10,508.30 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs -6608.10 Crore, while in June 2024, the net profit was Rs -6432.20 Crore. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs -0.63, compared to Rs -1.02 in June 2024. The following table represents the consolidated quarterly financial performance of the company:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 10,508.30 CroreRs 10,932.20 CroreRs 11,117.30 CroreRs 11,013.50 CroreRs 11,022.50 CroreNet Profit-Rs 6,432.20 Crore-Rs 7,175.60 Crore-Rs 6,609.30 Crore-Rs 7,168.10 Crore-Rs 6,608.10 CroreEPS-1.02-1.03-0.95-1.01-0.63For the year-ending March 2025, the company's revenue stood at Rs 43,571.30 Crore, compared to Rs 42,651.70 Crore in 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs -27385.20 Crore, while in 2024, the net profit was Rs -31232.90 Crore. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs -4.01, compared to Rs -6.41 in 2024. Here is a table illustrating the consolidated yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 41,952.20 CroreRs 38,515.50 CroreRs 42,177.20 CroreRs 42,651.70 CroreRs 43,571.30 CroreNet Profit-Rs 44,464.50 Crore-Rs 28,246.60 Crore-Rs 29,301.60 Crore-Rs 31,232.90 Crore-Rs 27,385.20 CroreEPS-15.40-9.83-8.43-6.41-4.01BVPS-13.30-19.29-15.28-20.78-9.85ROE0.000.000.000.000.00Debt to Equity-4.12-3.08-0.18-1.99-2.79Vodafone Idea has made several announcements recently. On September 10, 2025, the company released an investor presentation. On August 26, 2025, they shared the scrutinizer's report for the Annual General Meeting held on August 25, 2025, along with the voting results. Additionally, on the same day, they clarified a news article in the mainstream media under Regulation 30(11) of the SEBI Listing Regulations. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment for Vodafone Idea as of September 16, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 7.88, Vodafone Idea is experiencing a decline in today's session.

title: The Tata Power Company shares surge 2.65% amid volume surge
content: The Tata Power Company's stock is currently trading at Rs 398.30, marking a 2.65% increase from its previous close. The stock is experiencing high trading volume along with a volume surge in Tuesday's session. The stock is a constituent of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. On the financial front, The Tata Power Company has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. Consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 18,035.07 Crore, up from Rs 17,293.62 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 1,132.69 Crore, compared to Rs 899.22 Crore in the previous year. The company's annual performance also reflects strong financials. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 65,478.24 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 61,448.90 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 3,982.04 Crore, significantly higher than the Rs 3,102.53 Crore reported in the previous year. The management attended a Non-Deal Roadshow in London and Edinburgh from September 15, 2025, to September 17, 2025. Furthermore, Tata Power and Tata Passenger Electric Mobility Limited unveiled India's largest Tata.ev MegaCharger Hub on World EV Day. The Tata Power Company announced a final dividend of Rs 2.25 per share (225%) on May 14, 2025, with an effective date of June 20, 2025. The company had also announced a bonus issue on May 19, 1975, with a bonus ratio of 1:5. Moneycontrol analysis as of September 10, 2025, indicates a bullish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 398.30, The Tata Power Company exhibits strong market activity and positive financial performance.

title: KPR Mill, Global Health, MRF stocks among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: At 10:30 am on Tuesday, several stocks were identified as top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. These included KPR Mill, Global Health, MRF, Balkrishna Ind, and GE Vernova TD. KPR Mill led the gains with a 3.63% increase, reaching a price of Rs 1,085.00. Global Health followed, rising by 3.49% to Rs 1,371.80. MRF also saw a significant gain, increasing by 3.14% to Rs 152,035.00. Balkrishna Ind recorded a gain of 2.68%, trading at Rs 2,468.00, while GE Vernova TD saw an increase of 2.42%, reaching Rs 2,920.10. title: Page Industries shares rise 2.07% in morning trade
content: Shares of Page Industries gained 2.07% to trade at Rs 45,260 at 10:24 am on Tuesday. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Snapshot: The standalone financial results indicate the following trends: Income Statement: The company's annual sales have increased from Rs 4,581 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 4,934 Crore in March 2025. Other income also increased to Rs 61 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 19 Crore in March 2024. Consequently, the total income rose to Rs 4,996 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 4,601 Crore in March 2024. Total expenditure also saw an increase, rising to Rs 3,971 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 3,800 Crore in March 2024. The Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) increased from Rs 801 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 1,024 Crore in March 2025. The interest paid increased slightly to Rs 46 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 44 Crore in March 2024. The tax expenses increased to Rs 249 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 187 Crore in March 2024. The net profit increased from Rs 569 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 729 Crore in March 2025. For the quarter ending June 2025, the sales stood at Rs 1,316 Crore, which is slightly higher than the Rs 1,277 Crore in June 2024. title: Trump's tariffs bite off Rs 25,000 crore from shrimp exporters' profit, Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu seeks Centre's help
content: Trump's tariffs may have caused a loss of Rs 25,000 crore to India's shrimp exporters, with up to half of the export orders facing cancellations, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu has said. Chandrababu Naidu pegged the estimate in a letter to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and Fisheries Minister Rajiv Ranjan Singh, requesting government support for Andhra's aquaculture sector. “The taxes imposed by America majorly hit shrimp exports. It is estimated that a loss of Rs 25,000 crore would have occurred. Up to 50 percent export orders have been cancelled,” Chandrababu Naidu said in the letter. Andhra Pradesh makes up 80 percent of India's shrimp exports, worth over Rs 21,000 crore every year. During FY24, India exported record volume of seafood worth $7.38 billion, with USA and China being the major importers and frozen shrimp the largest export item, according to data from Marine Products Export Development Authority (MPEDA). During FY25, India shipped seafood worth Rs 62,408 crore ($7.45 billion). Naidu has called for a Rs 100 crore corpus fund, cold storages, and seafood markets, adding that the state is ready to set up a shrimp producers' committee to ensure farm-to-market supply chains. The state government has also initiated support measures by getting aquaculture feed prices lowered by Rs 9 per kg and is considering subsidised power transformers for the farms. CM Naidu has also sought a one-time top-up loan of Rs 1 lakh under Kisan Credit Card scheme for the farmers. This comes as the European Union approved 102 additional seafood processing and export units from India just days ago, a move that will boost seafood exports and position the nation as a trusted supplier. "This milestone will enable us to scale our EU trade, empower our farmer partners, and reaffirm India’s leadership in sustainable aquaculture and seafood exports," Chairman and Managing Director of Kings Infra, Shaji Baby John said on September 10. EU-bound exports from India had reached Rs 9,430 crore ($1.12 billion) last fiscal, led by frozen shrimps among the leading items. India is also in discussions with the EU for a wider FTA, with the next round of discussions scheduled on October 6-10. The EU is the third largest export destination for Indian shrimps, with US and China being the top two markets, in terms of turnover. In terms of quantity, China has emerged as the largest seafood export destination from India. CareEdge Ratings in a recent note had warned that if the current tariff levels persist, the hit on exports may be more pronounced next fiscal, and volumes may drop by up to 15 percent. India, along with Ecuador, Vietnam, Indonesia, Thailand, and China are the largest players in the global shrimp export market with a combined market share of around 75% in value terms and 74% in volume terms. Despite the export levy, shares of Avanti Feeds and Kings Infra are higher by 10 percent and 5 percent respectively over the last one month, while shares of Waterbase are flat for the period. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Trump's tariffs may have caused a loss of Rs 25,000 crore to India's shrimp exporters, with up to half of the export orders facing cancellations, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu has said.
summary_luhn: Trump's tariffs may have caused a loss of Rs 25,000 crore to India's shrimp exporters, with up to half of the export orders facing cancellations, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu has said.
summary_lsa: CM Naidu has also sought a one-time top-up loan of Rs 1 lakh under Kisan Credit Card scheme for the farmers.
summary_textrank: India, along with Ecuador, Vietnam, Indonesia, Thailand, and China are the largest players in the global shrimp export market with a combined market share of around 75% in value terms and 74% in volume terms.

title: Apollo Tyres shares rise 2.02%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Apollo Tyres gained 2.02%, trading at Rs 488.90 on Tuesday. The stock was among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, Apollo Tyres has shown consistent performance over the past few years. title: Larsen & Toubro among top gainers on Nifty 50; shares rise 0.94%
content: Larsen & Toubro shares were trading higher at Rs 3,620 on the NSE, a gain of 0.94% from the previous close, at 10:10 am on Tuesday. The stock is currently among the top gainers on the Nifty 50. Financial Performance Larsen & Toubro's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit. The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, up from Rs 3,440.11 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 255,734.45 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 221,112.91 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The annual net profit also increased from Rs 15,569.72 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 17,687.39 Crore in March 2025. title: Global Health shares rise 2.38%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Global Health were trading at Rs 1,357.10, up 2.38% in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 10:07 am. On the financial front, Global Health has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. The company's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,030.84 Crore, compared to Rs 861.08 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 158.98 Crore, up from Rs 106.26 Crore in the previous year. The consolidated annual revenue for Global Health has also seen a steady increase, reaching Rs 3,692.32 Crore for the year-ending 2025, compared to Rs 3,275.11 Crore in 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 481.32 Crore, slightly higher than the Rs 478.06 Crore reported in 2024. title: Godfrey Phillips shares surge 9% after turning ex-bonus: Here's why you should ignore the 66% plunge
content: The shares of Godfrey Phillips appeared to have crashed around 66 percent in one single session on September 16, as the stock price adjusted to a bonus issue of shares. The stock in reality jumped more than 9 percent after turning ex-bonus. Godfrey Phillips' board of directors during a meeting in August had approved the issue of bonus shares in the ratio of 2:1. The record date to determine the eligibility of the shareholders set to receive the bonus equity shares was set on September 16. What is a bonus issue? A company announces bonus issue of shares to reward its existing shareholders with an investment opportunity, which is perceived to be attractive. While the issue of bonus shares increases the total number of shares issued and owned, it does not change the market capitalization of the company. This increases the overall liquidity of the stock, and makes it more affordable for other investors to add to their portfolio, creating strong upside potential for the stock. Godfrey Phillips share price: Key details As a result, Godfrey Phillips’ shares appeared to have crashed 66 percent in one session, while in reality, they simply adjusted to the bonus issue. The stock jumped more than 9 percent to hit an intraday high of Rs 3,720 apiece. After the issuance of bonus shares, the company's market capitalization stands at around Rs 57,401 crore and the stock's P/E ratio nears 161. The issuance of bonus shares will likely increase investors' confidence for the stock, as it reflects on the firm's strong financials and growth potential. Bonus issue essentially are free shares offered by a company from its reserves. Investors must own shares of the company as on the record date to be eligible for the bonus issue. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: A company announces bonus issue of shares to reward its existing shareholders with an investment opportunity, which is perceived to be attractive.
summary_luhn: The shares of Godfrey Phillips appeared to have crashed around 66 percent in one single session on September 16, as the stock price adjusted to a bonus issue of shares.
summary_lsa: The stock jumped more than 9 percent to hit an intraday high of Rs 3,720 apiece.
summary_textrank: While the issue of bonus shares increases the total number of shares issued and owned, it does not change the market capitalization of the company.

title: Vodafone Idea, Ola Electric, Glenmark stocks among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150 today
content: Indian markets saw Vodafone Idea shares decline. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. At 10:00 am on Tuesday, Vodafone Idea was trading at Rs 7.96, down 2.21%. Ola Electric was trading at Rs 59.50, down 1.67%; Glenmark was trading at Rs 2,065.90, down 1.6%; Max Healthcare at Rs 1,157.60, down 1.51%; and BSE Limited at Rs 2,200.50, down 1.21%.Vodafone Idea Financial OverviewVodafone Idea's financial performance shows a mix of challenges and improvements. The company's consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 43,571.30 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 42,651.70 Crore in the previous year. However, the company reported a net loss of Rs 27,385.20 Crore for the same period. Key financial ratios show a P/E ratio of -1.70 and a P/B ratio of -0.69. Below is a detailed table presenting BSE Limited's financial performance:HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 3,212.04 CroreRs 1,592.50 CroreRs 924.84 CroreRs 743.15 CroreRs 501.37 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,234.47 CroreRs 699.84 CroreRs 156.42 CroreRs 180.75 CroreRs 98.55 CroreEPS96.5556.6616.0618.5130.94BVPS326.84255.24208.86206.26559.09ROE29.9723.578.169.585.81Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00Corporate ActionsVodafone Idea: The company made an announcement regarding investor presentation under Regulation 30 (LODR) on September 10, 2025. Also, the voting results together with Scrutinizer's report for the Annual General Meeting held on August 25, 2025, were enclosed. Additionally, there was a disclosure under Regulation 30(11) of SEBI Listing Regulations-Clarification on news article appearing in Mainstream Media on August 26, 2025. Ola Electric: The company announced the appointment of Mr. Abhishek Jain as Company Secretary & Compliance Officer of the Company with effect from September 12, 2025. There was an exchange regarding details of authorised KMPs to determine materiality event or information and its disclosures to the Stock Exchange on September 12, 2025. A general update regarding creation of pledge on promoter shares was announced on September 10, 2025. Glenmark Pharmaceuticals: Glenmark Pharmaceuticals announced the transfer of the Company's Consumer Care Business on September 15, 2025. Intimation regarding upfront payment received was announced on September 9, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 7.96, Vodafone Idea has seen a steady decline, making it among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150.

title: The Tata Power Company shares rise 2.32% in early trade
content: Shares of The Tata Power Company were trading higher at Rs 397 at 9:47 am on Tuesday, a 2.32% increase from the previous close. The stock is a constituent of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. Financial Snapshot: The following table presents a summary of The Tata Power Company's financial performance:ParticularsMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 32,468.10 CroreRs 42,815.67 CroreRs 55,109.08 CroreRs 61,448.90 CroreRs 65,478.24 CroreNet ProfitRs 611.46 CroreRs 680.61 CroreRs 610.21 CroreRs 3,102.53 CroreRs 3,982.04 CroreEPSRs 3.17Rs 5.36Rs 10.43Rs 11.56Rs 12.42BVPSRs 74.32Rs 81.45Rs 90.08Rs 101.25Rs 112.16ROE5.417.7511.5811.4211.07Debt to Equity1.852.121.701.531.62The company has demonstrated consistent growth in key financial metrics. Revenue increased from Rs 32,468.10 Crore in 2021 to Rs 65,478.24 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a significant rise, from Rs 611.46 Crore in 2021 to Rs 3,982.04 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the Earnings Per Share (EPS) rose from Rs 3.17 in 2021 to Rs 12.42 in 2025. title: Bharti Airtel shares rise 0.26% in early trade
content: Bharti Airtel shares were trading at Rs 1,909.40 on the NSE, up 0.26% from the previous close, at 9:30 am. Financial Snapshot: The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, compared to Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 7,339.00 Crore, versus Rs 3,805.80 Crore year-on-year. The company's EPS stood at Rs 10.26 in June 2025, compared to Rs 7.21 in June 2024. Annual Performance: The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 increased to Rs 172,985.20 Crore from Rs 149,982.40 Crore in March 2024. The net profit significantly increased to Rs 33,778.30 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 5,848.60 Crore in March 2024. The EPS also rose to Rs 58.00 in March 2025 from Rs 13.09 in March 2024. title: Larsen & Toubro shares gain 0.69% in early trade
content: Larsen & Toubro shares were trading at Rs 3,610.90 on the NSE, up 0.69% from the previous close, at 9:30 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Financial Snapshot: Larsen & Toubro's consolidated financial performance demonstrates steady growth. The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, up from Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, compared to Rs 3,440.11 Crore in the previous year. The company's annual revenue has consistently increased over the past five years. For the year-ending March 2025, revenue reached Rs 255,734.45 Crore, a significant rise from Rs 135,979.03 Crore in March 2021. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 17,687.39 Crore, up from Rs 4,668.96 Crore in March 2021.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Mar 2021135,979.034,668.9682.49Mar 2022156,521.2310,291.0561.71Mar 2023183,340.7012,624.8774.51Mar 2024221,112.9115,569.7293.96Mar 2025255,734.4517,687.39109.36Larsen & Toubro's revenue increased by 15.66% in 2025 compared to 2024, and the net profit increased by 13.60% during the same period. The company also announced that it won a large order in the Bullet Train Project on September 15, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 34 per share with an effective date of June 3, 2025. Historically, Larsen & Toubro has issued bonus shares, with the most recent bonus issue on July 13, 2017, in the ratio of 1:2. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3,610.90, Larsen & Toubro shows a marginal gain in the early trading session.

title: Premier Energies shares rise 2.06% in early trade
content: At 9:44 am, Premier Energies shares were trading at Rs 1,073.10 on the NSE, a gain of 2.06% from the previous close. Premier Energies stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. (x)1.751.212.655.997.68Corporate Actions: Cochin Shipyard has announced several corporate actions. On September 15, 2025, there was an announcement regarding a change in management, specifically the appointment to senior management. Additionally, on September 11, 2025, the company announced the appointment of statutory auditors. A public notice to shareholders was issued on September 3, 2025, concerning Rule 20(4)(v) of the Companies (Management and Administration) Rules, 2014. The company has also declared dividends. A final dividend of Rs 2.25 per share (45%) was announced on May 15, 2025, with an effective date of September 12, 2025. In terms of stock splits, Cochin Shipyard announced a split on November 7, 2023, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split into a new face value of Rs 5. The ex-split and record date was January 10, 2024. Moneycontrol analysis, as of September 12, 2025, indicates a bullish sentiment on the stock. Cochin Shipyard, with its current trading price reflecting positive movement, showcases a strong presence in the market.

title: NLC India shares rise 2.09% in early trade
content: Shares of NLC India were trading at Rs 267.40, up 2.09% in Tuesday's session. At 9:52 am, the stock showed positive movement, trading higher compared to its previous close. NLC India is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index.Financial PerformanceNLC India's financial performance shows consistent revenue and profit growth over the past few years. title: Container Corporation of India shares rise 2.06%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Container Corporation of India's shares gained 2.06% to trade at Rs 567.45 in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index, as of 9:51 am.Financial PerformanceHere's a look at the consolidated quarterly and annual financial performance of Container Corporation of India:Consolidated Quarterly FinancialsHeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,103.13 CroreRs 2,287.75 CroreRs 2,208.31 CroreRs 2,287.83 CroreRs 2,153.63 CroreNet ProfitRs 260.24 CroreRs 371.25 CroreRs 340.52 CroreRs 287.69 CroreRs 259.13 CroreEPS4.266.016.034.913.51The revenue for Container Corporation of India has fluctuated over the last five quarters, with a high of Rs 2,287.83 Crore in March 2025 and a low of Rs 2,103.13 Crore in June 2024. Net profit also saw variations, peaking at Rs 371.25 Crore in September 2024 and dipping to Rs 259.13 Crore in June 2025.Consolidated Yearly FinancialsHeading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 6,427.08 CroreRs 7,652.73 CroreRs 8,169.12 CroreRs 8,653.41 CroreRs 8,887.02 CroreNet ProfitRs 469.30 CroreRs 1,028.37 CroreRs 1,152.33 CroreRs 1,232.04 CroreRs 1,259.70 CroreEPS8.2217.2719.2620.7121.20BVPS168.90178.18185.92195.74203.19ROE4.959.8110.4510.6610.40Debt to Equity0.010.010.000.000.00The annual revenue has shown a consistent increase from Rs 6,427.08 Crore in 2021 to Rs 8,887.02 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the net profit has risen from Rs 469.30 Crore in 2021 to Rs 1,259.70 Crore in 2025. The Debt to Equity ratio has remained relatively stable at around 0.00-0.01 over the years.Corporate ActionsContainer Corporation of India has announced several corporate actions, including bonus issues and dividends.Bonus Issues:On May 22, 2025, a bonus ratio of 1:4 was announced, with a record date of July 4, 2025, and an ex-bonus date of July 4, 2025.Similar bonus issues of 1:4 were announced on December 20, 2018, and February 13, 2017.Dividends:An interim dividend of Rs 1.60 per share (32%) was announced on August 5, 2025, with an effective date of August 13, 2025.A final dividend of Rs 2.00 per share (40%) was announced on May 22, 2025, with an effective date of June 6, 2025.Additionally, appointments of Statutory Auditors were announced on September 15, 2025, and changes in senior management were announced on September 8, 2025. Container Corporation of India is moved by 2.06.

title: Vodafone Idea shares fall 2.46% in early trade
content: Shares of Vodafone Idea declined by 2.46% to trade at Rs 7.94 in early trade. At 9:54 am, the stock was trading lower on the NSE. Financial Snapshot: The following table summarizes the key financial data for Vodafone Idea:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 10,508.30 CroreRs 10,932.20 CroreRs 11,117.30 CroreRs 11,013.50 CroreRs 11,022.50 CroreNet Profit-Rs 6,432.20 Crore-Rs 7,175.60 Crore-Rs 6,609.30 Crore-Rs 7,168.10 Crore-Rs 6,608.10 CroreEPS-Rs 1.02-Rs 1.03-Rs 0.95-Rs 1.01-Rs 0.63The consolidated quarterly revenue saw a slight increase from Rs 10,508.30 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 11,022.50 Crore in June 2025. However, the company has reported net losses in each of the last five quarters, with EPS remaining negative. Annual Financial Performance: The yearly financial performance is detailed below:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 41,952.20 CroreRs 38,515.50 CroreRs 42,177.20 CroreRs 42,651.70 CroreRs 43,571.30 CroreNet Profit-Rs 44,464.50 Crore-Rs 28,246.60 Crore-Rs 29,301.60 Crore-Rs 31,232.90 Crore-Rs 27,385.20 CroreEPS-Rs 15.40-Rs 9.83-Rs 8.43-Rs 6.41-Rs 4.01BVPS-Rs 13.30-Rs 19.29-Rs 15.28-Rs 20.78-Rs 9.85ROE0.000.000.000.000.00Debt to Equity-Rs 4.12-Rs 3.08-Rs 0.18-Rs 1.99-Rs 2.79The consolidated annual revenue increased steadily from Rs 41,952.20 Crore in 2021 to Rs 43,571.30 Crore in 2025. The annual net loss decreased from Rs 44,464.50 Crore in 2021 to Rs 27,385.20 Crore in 2025. The Debt to Equity ratio is negative for all years. title: Nifty Top Loser: Asian Paints, Titan Company stocks drag on Nifty 50 index today
content: Shares of Asian Paints and Titan Company were among the top losers on the Nifty 50 in Tuesday's early trading session. At 09:30 am, Asian Paints was trading at Rs 2,489.70, a 0.52% decline from its previous close. Titan Company was trading at Rs 3,516.00, down by 0.51%. Other stocks that experienced losses include TATA Cons. Prod, HDFC Bank, and Shriram Finance. Asian Paints Financial Overview: Asian Paints' financial performance reveals the following trends:Quarterly Performance: The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 8,938.55 Crore, slightly down from Rs 8,969.73 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 1,080.73 Crore, compared to Rs 1,150.07 Crore in the previous year.Annual Performance: For the year-ending March 2025, Asian Paints reported revenue of Rs 33,905.62 Crore and a net profit of Rs 3,569.00 Crore. title: KPR Mill shares rise 2.45%, stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of KPR Mill were trading higher at Rs 1,072.60, up 2.45% in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 9:34 am. Financial Overview: KPR Mill's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. title: Nifty top gainers: Kotak Mahindra, Axis Bank stocks lead on Nifty 50 index today
content: In Tuesday's session, several stocks showed positive momentum, with Kotak Mahindra and Axis Bank leading the gains on the Nifty 50 index. At 9:30 am, Kotak Mahindra was trading at Rs 1,991.00, up by 1.02%. Axis Bank was trading at Rs 1,113.10, a rise of 0.79%. NTPC, Larsen, and Bajaj Finserv also showed positive movement, contributing to the overall positive sentiment in the market. Kotak Mahindra Financial Overview: Kotak Mahindra's financial performance reveals consistent growth over the past few years. Key financial ratios for Kotak Mahindra show a P/E ratio of 19.51 and a P/B ratio of 2.74. The company reported a net interest margin of 4.25% and a return on equity of 14.04% as of the year-ending March 2025. The income statement for Kotak Mahindra shows a steady increase in interest earned, from Rs 32,819 Crore in 2021 to Rs 65,668 Crore in 2025. Total income also increased from Rs 56,814 Crore in 2021 to Rs 106,902 Crore in 2025. The net profit saw a significant increase from Rs 9,903 Crore in 2021 to Rs 21,946 Crore in 2025. Axis Bank Financial Overview: Axis Bank has also demonstrated robust financial performance. Key financial ratios for Axis Bank show a P/E ratio of 12.15 and a P/B ratio of 1.82. The company reported a net interest margin of 3.40% and a return on equity of 14.98% as of the year-ending March 2025. The income statement for Axis Bank shows a steady increase in interest earned, from Rs 64,696 Crore in 2021 to Rs 127,374 Crore in 2025. Total income also increased from Rs 80,847 Crore in 2021 to Rs 155,916 Crore in 2025. The net profit saw a significant increase from Rs 7,252 Crore in 2021 to Rs 28,115 Crore in 2025. NTPC was trading at Rs 333.45, up by 0.71%. Larsen was trading at Rs 3,610.90, a rise of 0.69%. Bajaj Finserv was trading at Rs 2,091.80, up by 0.57%. Among recent corporate actions, Kotak Mahindra announced analyst/investor meets and has a final dividend of Rs 2.50 per share, with an effective date of 18 Jul, 2025. Axis Bank also scheduled analyst/institutional investor meets and has a final dividend of Rs 1.00 per share, effective from 04 Jul, 2025. NTPC declared a final dividend of Rs 3.35 per share, effective 04 Sep, 2025. Larsen & Toubro announced analyst/investor meet. Bajaj Finserv announced approval of the amendment to the Code of Practices and Procedures for Fair Disclosure of Unpublished Price Sensitive Information (UPSI) and has a final dividend of Rs 1.00 per share, effective 27 Jun, 2025. With Kotak Mahindra and Axis Bank leading the gains, the Nifty 50 index is showing a positive trend in the pre-opening session.
summary_lexrank: The income statement for Axis Bank shows a steady increase in interest earned, from Rs 64,696 Crore in 2021 to Rs 127,374 Crore in 2025.
summary_luhn: The income statement for Kotak Mahindra shows a steady increase in interest earned, from Rs 32,819 Crore in 2021 to Rs 65,668 Crore in 2025.
summary_lsa: Axis Bank also scheduled analyst/institutional investor meets and has a final dividend of Rs 1.00 per share, effective from 04 Jul, 2025.
summary_textrank: Bajaj Finserv announced approval of the amendment to the Code of Practices and Procedures for Fair Disclosure of Unpublished Price Sensitive Information (UPSI) and has a final dividend of Rs 1.00 per share, effective 27 Jun, 2025.

title: Top Midcap Gainers: Bharti Hexacom, Balkrishna Ind stocks lead on Nifty Midcap 150 index today
content: Top gainers in the Nifty Midcap 150 index include Bharti Hexacom, Balkrishna Ind, United Brewerie, KPR Mill and HDFC AMC. At 09:30 am, Bharti Hexacom was trading at Rs 1,737.90, a 2.22% gain from its previous close. Balkrishna Ind was trading at Rs 2,454.60, up 2.12%. United Brewerie was trading at Rs 1,829.00, up 1.74%. KPR Mill was trading at Rs 1,062.90, up 1.52% and HDFC AMC was trading at Rs 5,820.00, a 1.32% gain. Bharti Hexacom Financials: For the quarter ending June 2025, Bharti Hexacom's sales stood at Rs 2,263 Crore, compared to Rs 2,289 Crore in March 2025. The company's net profit for the same quarter was Rs 391 Crore, while it was Rs 468 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025. The company’s annual sales for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 8,547 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 7,088 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 1,493 Crore, compared to Rs 504 Crore in March 2024. Key financial ratios for Bharti Hexacom show a basic EPS of Rs 29.87 and a diluted EPS of Rs 29.87 as of March 2025. The book value per share stood at Rs 118.64. The company's dividend per share was Rs 10.00, with a face value of Rs 5. Cash flow from operating activities for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 4,582 Crore. The company reported total assets of Rs 19,251 Crore for the year ending March 2025. Balkrishna Ind Financials: Balkrishna Ind's quarterly revenue for June 2025 stood at Rs 2,760.02 Crore, up from Rs 2,752.38 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for June 2025 was Rs 288.30 Crore, down from Rs 368.55 Crore in March 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) for June 2025 was Rs 14.91, compared to Rs 19.06 in March 2025. The company's annual revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 10,446.95 Crore, compared to Rs 9,368.87 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 1,654.96 Crore, up from Rs 1,471.49 Crore in March 2024. The basic EPS for March 2025 was Rs 85.61, compared to Rs 76.12 for March 2024. Key financial ratios for Balkrishna Ind include a basic EPS of Rs 85.61 and a diluted EPS of Rs 85.61 for March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 537.38. The company’s dividend per share was Rs 16.00, with a face value of Rs 2. Cash flow from operating activities for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 1,764 Crore. The company's total assets for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 15,634 Crore. United Brewerie Financials: For the quarter ending June 2025, United Brewerie's revenue stood at Rs 2,864.32 Crore, compared to Rs 2,322.98 Crore in March 2025. The company's net profit for the same quarter was Rs 184.03 Crore, while it was Rs 97.76 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025. The company’s annual sales for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 8,915.09 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 8,122.68 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 442.41 Crore, compared to Rs 410.86 Crore in March 2024. Key financial ratios for United Brewerie show a basic EPS of Rs 16.71 and a diluted EPS of Rs 16.71 for March 2025. The book value per share stood at Rs 165.05. The company's dividend per share was Rs 10.00, with a face value of Rs 1. Cash flow from operating activities for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 235 Crore. The company reported total assets of Rs 8,222 Crore for the year ending March 2025. KPR Mill Financials: KPR Mill's quarterly revenue for June 2025 stood at Rs 1,766.27 Crore, slightly down from Rs 1,768.98 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for June 2025 was Rs 212.70 Crore, up from Rs 204.55 Crore in March 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) for June 2025 was Rs 6.22, compared to Rs 5.98 in March 2025. The company's annual revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 6,387.88 Crore, compared to Rs 6,059.68 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 815.11 Crore, up from Rs 805.35 Crore in March 2024. The basic EPS for March 2025 was Rs 23.85, compared to Rs 23.56 for March 2024. Key financial ratios for KPR Mill include a basic EPS of Rs 23.85 and a diluted EPS of Rs 23.85 for March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 146.34. The company’s dividend per share was Rs 5.00, with a face value of Rs 1. Cash flow from operating activities for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 1,401 Crore. The company's total assets for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 5,961 Crore. HDFC AMC Financials: For the quarter ending June 2025, HDFC AMC's sales stood at Rs 968.15 Crore, compared to Rs 901.36 Crore in March 2025. The company's net profit for the same quarter was Rs 747.55 Crore, while it was Rs 638.46 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025. The company’s annual sales for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 3,498.44 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 2,584.37 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 2,460.19 Crore, compared to Rs 1,942.69 Crore in March 2024. Key financial ratios for HDFC AMC show a basic EPS of Rs 115.16 and a diluted EPS of Rs 114.75 as of March 2025. The book value per share stood at Rs 380.26. The company's dividend per share was Rs 90.00, with a face value of Rs 5. Cash flow from operating activities for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 2,074 Crore. The company reported total assets of Rs 8,750 Crore for the year ending March 2025. Top gainers in the Nifty Midcap 150 index include Bharti Hexacom, Balkrishna Ind, United Brewerie, KPR Mill and HDFC AMC.
