title: J. K. Cement shares rise 2.20% in early trade
content: Shares of J. K. Cement were trading higher at Rs 6,617.50, up by 2.20% in early trade Tuesday, at 09:34 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, J. K. Cement has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual revenues. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,352.53 Crore, up from Rs 2,807.57 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same quarter was Rs 324.24 Crore, compared to Rs 184.82 Crore in the previous year. The company's annual performance also reflects strong financials. Revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 11,879.15 Crore, an increase from Rs 11,556.00 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 871.58 Crore, compared to Rs 789.93 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) also saw an increase, rising from Rs 102.35 in March 2024 to Rs 111.44 in March 2025. J. K. title: Top Midcap Losers: Ola Electric, Cochin Shipyard stocks fall most on Nifty Midcap 150 index today

At 9:30 am, Ola Electric's stock was trading at Rs 59.35, a 1.92% drop from the previous close. title: Bharti Hexacom shares rise 2.22% in early trade
content: Bharti Hexacom shares gained 2.22% to trade at Rs 1,737.90 in early trade. At 9:30 am, the stock is trading positively on Tuesday's session. The company's standalone financials reveal consistent performance over the years. Sales for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 8,547 Crore, up from Rs 7,088 Crore in March 2024 and Rs 6,579 Crore in March 2023. Total income for the same period increased from Rs 7,337 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 8,729 Crore in March 2025. Net profit showed a significant increase to Rs 1,493 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 504 Crore in March 2024. The quarterly results also reflect a positive trend. Sales for June 2025 were Rs 2,263 Crore, slightly down from Rs 2,289 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for June 2025 was Rs 391 Crore, down from Rs 468 Crore in March 2025. Here is a summary of Bharti Hexacom's key financial data:Standalone (Annual)Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 8,547 CroreRs 7,088 CroreRs 6,579 CroreRs 5,405 CroreRs 4,602 CroreOther IncomeRs 181 CroreRs 248 CroreRs 140 CroreRs 88 CroreRs 102 CroreTotal IncomeRs 8,729 CroreRs 7,337 CroreRs 6,719 CroreRs 5,494 CroreRs 4,704 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 6,232 CroreRs 5,769 CroreRs 5,346 CroreRs 3,081 CroreRs 5,176 CroreEBITRs 2,497 CroreRs 1,567 CroreRs 1,372 CroreRs 2,412 CroreRs -472 CroreInterestRs 688 CroreRs 644 CroreRs 638 CroreRs 571 CroreRs 516 CroreTaxRs 315 CroreRs 418 CroreRs 184 CroreRs 166 CroreRs 44 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,493 CroreRs 504 CroreRs 549 CroreRs 1,674 CroreRs -1,033 CroreStandalone (Quarterly)Jun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024SalesRs 2,263 CroreRs 2,289 CroreRs 2,250 CroreRs 2,097 CroreRs 1,910 CroreOther IncomeRs 47 CroreRs 47 CroreRs 45 CroreRs 49 CroreRs 39 CroreTotal IncomeRs 2,310 CroreRs 2,336 CroreRs 2,295 CroreRs 2,146 CroreRs 1,950 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 1,629 CroreRs 1,652 CroreRs 1,736 CroreRs 1,631 CroreRs 1,212 CroreEBITRs 680 CroreRs 684 CroreRs 559 CroreRs 514 CroreRs 738 CroreInterestRs 154 CroreRs 171 CroreRs 180 CroreRs 175 CroreRs 161 CroreTaxRs 135 CroreRs 44 CroreRs 118 CroreRs 86 CroreRs 65 CroreNet ProfitRs 391 CroreRs 468 CroreRs 260 CroreRs 253 CroreRs 511 CroreBharti Hexacom's balance sheet for March 2025 shows a share capital of Rs 250 Crore and reserves & surplus of Rs 5,682 Crore. The total assets and total liabilities each amount to Rs 19,251 Crore. The basic and diluted EPS stand at Rs 29.87 as of March 2025, with a dividend of Rs 10 per share. Key ratios include a Return on Networth / Equity of 25.17% and a Debt to Equity ratio of 0.64. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 10 per share on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of July 25, 2025. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,737.90, Bharti Hexacom is currently trading positively.

title: United Breweries shares rise 2% in early trade
content: Shares of United Breweries were trading at Rs 1,833.80, up 2% from the previous close, in early trade on Tuesday. On the financial front, United Breweries has demonstrated consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 8,915.09 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 8,122.68 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 442.41 Crore, up from Rs 410.86 Crore in the previous year. The company’s quarterly performance also reflects a positive trajectory. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 2,864.32 Crore, compared to Rs 2,475.13 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The company had previously announced a stock split on April 26, 2006, with an ex-split date of June 9, 2006, and a record date of June 16, 2006. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Moneycontrol analysis, as of September 16, 2025, indicates a very bearish sentiment for the stock. Shares of United Breweries were trading positively in Tuesday's session.

title: NTPC Green Energy shares rise 2.79% in early trade
content: NTPC Green Energy shares experienced a rise of 2.79% to reach Rs 106.45 in early trading. At 09:18 am, the stock showed positive movement, reflecting early market activity. Financial Snapshot: The following table summarizes the key financial figures for NTPC Green Energy:Heading202320242025RevenueRs 169.69 CroreRs 1,962.60 CroreRs 2,209.64 CroreNet ProfitRs 171.23 CroreRs 344.72 CroreRs 475.35 CroreEPSRs 4.66Rs 0.73Rs 0.67BVPSRs 10.36Rs 10.90Rs 21.88ROE3.505.532.57Debt to Equity1.112.050.97The revenue for NTPC Green Energy has shown significant growth from Rs 169.69 Crore in 2023 to Rs 2,209.64 Crore in 2025. title: Cochin Shipyard shares fall over 2% in early trade
content: Shares of Cochin Shipyard declined by 2.06% to Rs 1,770.60 in early trade on Tuesday. At 9:18 am, the stock experienced this dip on the NSE. It is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On September 15, 2025, Cochin Shipyard announced changes in management, as disclosed under Regulation 30 of SEBI LODR. The company also announced the appointment of statutory auditors on September 11, 2025. title: Fortis Healthcare stock hits all-time high of Rs 982.50 on BSE

title: Balmer Lawrie stock turns ex-dividend today; investors eye Rs 8.5 per share payout
content: Balmer Lawrie & Co. announced a final dividend of ₹8.50 per share. The ex-date for this dividend is today, September 16, 2025. Investors who owned the stock before today will be eligible for the dividend payout. The company's stock last traded at ₹235.50, reflecting a 1.74% increase compared to its previous closing price. The company has a market capitalization of 4,027 Crore.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹8.50Ex-DateSeptember 16, 2025Financial Performance Overview: Balmer Lawrie's financial performance reveals consistent revenue and profit generation. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at ₹2,515.64 Crore, a notable increase from ₹2,339.23 Crore in the previous year. Net profit for the same period was ₹194.82 Crore, slightly lower than the ₹199.31 Crore reported in the year prior. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased from ₹15.30 to ₹15.55. Quarterly, the company's revenue reached ₹680.66 Crore in June 2025, up from ₹608.16 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the June 2025 quarter was ₹51.98 Crore, compared to ₹58.78 Crore in the previous quarter.Key Financial Metrics (Consolidated)MetricYear Ending Mar 2025 (₹ Crore)Year Ending Mar 2024 (₹ Crore)YoY Change (%)Quarter Ending Jun 2025 (₹ Crore)Quarter Ending Mar 2025 (₹ Crore)Revenue2,515.642,339.23+7.55%680.66608.16Net Profit194.82199.31-2.25%51.9858.78EPS15.5515.30+1.63%4.034.39Annual Income Statement Highlights: The company's annual income statement for the year ending March 2025 shows sales of ₹2,515 Crore, up from ₹2,339 Crore in the previous year. Total income increased to ₹2,565 Crore from ₹2,390 Crore. Total expenditure also rose to ₹2,263 Crore from ₹2,093 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of ₹302 Crore, compared to ₹296 Crore in the prior year. Net profit stood at ₹194 Crore, slightly below the previous year's ₹199 Crore. Quarterly Income Statement Highlights: For the quarter ending June 2025, sales reached ₹680 Crore, up from ₹608 Crore in the previous quarter. Total income was ₹690 Crore, and total expenditure was ₹611 Crore, leading to an EBIT of ₹78 Crore. The net profit for the quarter was ₹51 Crore. Balance Sheet Snapshot: The company's balance sheet indicates a strong financial position. As of March 2025, total equities and liabilities amounted to ₹3,039 Crore, with share capital remaining constant at ₹171 Crore. Reserves and surplus increased to ₹1,797 Crore from ₹1,649 Crore. Total assets also stood at ₹3,039 Crore, with fixed assets at ₹804 Crore and current assets at ₹1,580 Crore. Cash Flow Analysis: Cash flow from operating activities was ₹156 Crore, while investing activities generated ₹22 Crore and financing activities resulted in an outflow of ₹188 Crore. The net cash flow for the year was a decrease of ₹9 Crore. Key Ratios: Key financial ratios reveal insights into the company's performance. The Basic EPS for March 2025 was ₹15.55, up from ₹15.30 in the previous year. The Book Value per Share increased to ₹115.12 from ₹108.06. Return on Networth/Equity stood at 13.50%, slightly lower than the 14.36% in the previous year. The Debt to Equity ratio remained stable at 0.04. The last value of Balmer Lawrie's stock was ₹235.50, with a gain of 1.74% yesterday.

title: One Mobikwik AGM due today; shares gain 6% on Monday ahead of the meet
content: One Mobikwik shares rose by nearly 6% to end at Rs 314.7 on Monday, ahead of its Annual General Meeting (AGM). The AGM's ex-date is due today, September 16, 2025. The company's market capitalization stands at Rs 2,459 crore. One Mobikwik, which got listed on the stock exchanges in December 2024, is a constituent of the Nifty IPO index. The stock demonstrated a positive movement compared to the previous day's closing price, reflecting investor interest surrounding the upcoming AGM. Financial Performance Overview: One Mobikwik's financial performance reveals a mixed trend. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 1,170.17 crore, a notable increase from Rs 875.00 crore in the previous year. However, the company reported a net loss of Rs 121.53 crore for the same period, a downturn compared to the net profit of Rs 14.08 crore in the year prior. Examining the quarterly results, the company's revenue for June 2025 stood at Rs 271.36 crore, while the net loss amounted to Rs 41.92 crore. These figures provide insights into the company's recent operational dynamics.Key Financial Metrics (Consolidated)MetricMar 2025 (₹ Cr)Mar 2024 (₹ Cr)Mar 2023 (₹ Cr)Revenue1,170.17875.00539.47Net Profit-121.5314.08-83.81EPS-19.272.46-14.66BVPS75.7728.4324.95ROE (%)-20.648.65-58.73Debt to Equity0.461.301.35Quarterly Performance:Quarterly Financials (₹ Cr)MetricJun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Revenue271.36267.78269.48290.65342.27Net Profit-41.92-56.04-55.28-3.59-6.62EPS-5.39-8.88-9.48-0.63-1.16Balance Sheet Highlights:Balance Sheet (Consolidated - ₹ Cr)ParticularsMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Share Capital151111Reserves & Surplus5739278Current Liabilities753638535Total Liabilities1,360854714Fixed Assets251514Current Assets1,198690550Total Assets1,360854714Total liabilities of One Mobikwik stood at Rs 1,360 crore as of March 2025, compared to total assets of Rs 1,360 crore. Current assets were Rs 1,198 crore, and current liabilities were Rs 753 crore, indicating a current ratio of 1.59. The One Mobikwik's AGM, coupled with its recent financial performance, is likely to be a key topic of discussion among investors and stakeholders.

title: RITES final dividend ex-date due tomorrow, investors to get Rs 2.65 per share; last day today to trade
content: RITES announced a final dividend of ₹2.65 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, September 17, 2025. This makes today the last day to trade the stock before it turns ex-dividend; investors who own the stock today will be eligible for the dividend payout. RITES' shares last traded at ₹275.14, marking a 2.70% increase compared to the previous day's closing price. This dividend announcement follows a period of fluctuating financial performance for the company. RITES, a transport infrastructure consultancy and engineering firm, has a market capitalization of approximately ₹13,223.33 crore. The dividend payout reflects the company's commitment to rewarding shareholders amidst evolving financial dynamics.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹2.65Ex-DateSeptember 17, 2025The company's recent financial performance reveals some key trends. Consolidated revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at ₹489.74 crore, slightly up from ₹485.76 crore in June 2024. However, it is lower compared to the revenue figures from subsequent quarters of the previous fiscal year, with ₹540.86 crore in September 2024, ₹575.76 crore in December 2024, and ₹615.43 crore in March 2025. Net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was ₹88.52 crore, a marginal increase from ₹88.27 crore in June 2024. The net profit peaked at ₹137.63 crore in March 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) for June 2025 were reported at ₹1.67. Looking at the yearly performance, the company's revenue has seen a decline over the past five years. The revenue for the year 2025 was ₹2,217.81 crore, compared to ₹2,452.85 crore in 2024, ₹2,628.27 crore in 2023, ₹2,661.83 crore in 2022, and ₹1,859.54 crore in 2021. The net profit also showed a similar downward trend, with ₹411.43 crore in 2025, ₹489.73 crore in 2024, ₹570.00 crore in 2023, ₹537.86 crore in 2022, and ₹443.14 crore in 2021. The EPS for 2025 stood at ₹8.01, significantly lower than the previous years. Key financial ratios indicate a changing landscape. The book value per share (BVPS) for 2025 was ₹54.93, a notable decrease from ₹113.23 in 2024. The return on equity (ROE) was 16.04% in 2025. The company maintains a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00, indicating a low level of debt. RITES' announcement of a final dividend, coupled with its current market performance and underlying financial data, presents a mixed picture for investors. While the dividend provides an immediate return, the declining revenue and profit trends warrant a closer examination of the company's strategic direction and operational efficiencies.

summary_luhn: The revenue for the year 2025 was ₹2,217.81 crore, compared to ₹2,452.85 crore in 2024, ₹2,628.27 crore in 2023, ₹2,661.83 crore in 2022, and ₹1,859.54 crore in 2021.

title: Garware HiTech final dividend ex-date due tomorrow, investors eye Rs 12 per share payout; trade today
content: Garware HiTech announced a final dividend of ₹12.00 per share -- the ex-date for this dividend is due tomorrow, September 17, 2025. This makes today the last day to trade the stock before it turns ex-dividend; investors who own the stock today will be eligible for the payout. Dividend DetailsThe final dividend announcement includes a dividend of ₹12.00 per share. Shareholders should note that the ex-date, which determines eligibility for the dividend.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹12.00Ex-DateSeptember 17, 2025Historical ContextComparing the current dividend with previous years provides insight into Garware HiTech's dividend payout trend. The company’s dividend history shows consistent payouts, with a dividend of ₹10.00 per share in each of the years 2021, 2022 and 2023 and ₹10 in 2024. The increase to ₹12.00 this year is a positive signal for investors.Dividend HistoryYearDividend per Share (₹)202110.00202210.00202310.00202410.00202512.00Shareholder Impact and YieldFor shareholders, the dividend represents a direct return on investment. While the dividend yield cannot be precisely calculated without the record date and payment date, the ₹12.00 dividend on a stock priced at Rs 3,332.40 provides a tangible benefit. Investors often view consistent or increasing dividend payouts as a sign of financial stability and confidence from the company's management.

title: HCL Infosystems AGM due tomorrow; shares fall by 3.43% in Monday's session
content: HCL Infosystem's Annual General Meeting (AGM) is due tomorrow, September 17, 2025. The company's shares experienced a decline of 3.43% on Monday, with the last traded price at Rs 15.49. Financial Performance: HCL Info has demonstrated fluctuating financial performance over the past year. Analyzing the quarterly results, the revenue figures show variation, with June 2024 reporting Rs 7.47 crore, decreasing to Rs 6.79 crore in September 2024, Rs 5.70 crore in December 2024, and further down to Rs 4.65 crore in March 2025. However, there was a slight recovery in June 2025 with revenue reaching Rs 7.03 crore. The net profit figures have consistently remained negative, with losses of Rs 4.13 crore in June 2024, which deepened to Rs 7.84 crore by September 2024, then improved slightly to losses of Rs 5.25 crore and Rs 3.90 crore in December 2024 and March 2025 respectively, before rising again to Rs 4.50 crore in June 2025. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) mirrors this trend, ranging from -Rs 0.12 to -Rs 0.24 across the quarters.Quarterly Financial Performance (in ₹ crore)MetricJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Revenue7.47 Cr6.79 Cr5.70 Cr4.65 Cr7.03 CrNet Profit-4.13 Cr-7.84 Cr-5.25 Cr-3.90 Cr-4.50 CrEPS-0.13-0.24-0.16-0.12-0.14Yearly data reveals a concerning trend in revenue. From Rs 352.75 crore in 2021, revenue significantly dropped to Rs 69.44 crore in 2022, and further to Rs 31.41 crore in 2023 and Rs 32.17 crore in 2024. The latest figure for 2025 shows a decline to Rs 24.61 crore. Net profit has also been inconsistent, with a substantial loss of Rs 196.73 crore in 2021, followed by a profit of Rs 24.52 crore in 2022, but then losses of Rs 38.79 crore in 2023, Rs 15.87 crore in 2024 and Rs 21.11 crore in 2025. EPS values mirror this pattern, with negative figures except for a positive value in 2022.Yearly Financial Performance (in ₹ crore)Metric20212022202320242025Revenue352.75 Cr69.44 Cr31.41 Cr32.17 Cr24.61 CrNet Profit-196.73 Cr24.52 Cr-38.79 Cr-15.87 Cr-21.11 CrEPS-5.980.74-1.18-0.48-0.64BVPS-7.29-6.53-7.70-8.18-8.84ROE0.00-11.390.000.000.00Debt to Equity-1.97-1.92-1.40-1.32-1.22Corporate Action - AGM The Annual General Meeting (AGM) of HCL Info is scheduled for September 17, 2025. Shareholders will be closely monitoring the discussions and decisions made during the AGM, especially in light of the company's recent financial performance and future strategies.

summary_luhn: The net profit figures have consistently remained negative, with losses of Rs 4.13 crore in June 2024, which deepened to Rs 7.84 crore by September 2024, then improved slightly to losses of Rs 5.25 crore and Rs 3.90 crore in December 2024 and March 2025 respectively, before rising again to Rs 4.50 crore in June 2025.

summary_textrank: Net profit has also been inconsistent, with a substantial loss of Rs 196.73 crore in 2021, followed by a profit of Rs 24.52 crore in 2022, but then losses of Rs 38.79 crore in 2023, Rs 15.87 crore in 2024 and Rs 21.11 crore in 2025.

title: DLF shares rise 2.3% on Monday, among top gainers on Nifty Next 50
content: Shares of DLF ended positively yesterday, with the stock among the top gainers on the Nifty Next 50. The stock closed at Rs 775.70 in Monday's trading, a rise of 2.28%. Financial Snapshot: The following tables provide an overview of DLF's financial performance. Consolidated Quarterly Results:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,362.35 CroreRs 1,975.02 CroreRs 1,528.71 CroreRs 3,127.58 CroreRs 2,716.70 CroreNet ProfitRs 339.28 CroreRs 1,043.41 CroreRs 440.40 CroreRs 871.42 CroreRs 382.12 CroreEPS2.615.584.285.183.08The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,716.70 Crore, compared to Rs 3,127.58 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 382.12 Crore, down from Rs 871.42 Crore in the previous quarter.
